headline.main: National Briefing | Education: Student Poll On War Issues

lead_paragraph: While college students overwhelmingly support sending American ground troops into Afghanistan, nearly 7 out of 10 oppose reinstating the draft, a nationwide poll shows. The poll, commissioned by the Institute of Politics at Harvard University, found that 71 percent of men and 49 percent of women would serve if drafted. Seven out of 10 college students say they have donated blood, given money or volunteered in relief efforts since the Sept. 11 attacks. The survey of 1,200 undergraduates, conducted by the Boston firm of SWR/DellaVolpe from Oct. 17 to 25, has a margin of error of plus or minus three percentage points. Richard L. Berke (NYT)
abstract: Nationwide poll conducted by Institute of Politics at Harvard finds that while college students overwhelmingly support sending American ground troops into Afghanistan, nearly 7 out of 10 oppose reinstating draft (S)
